alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 2:20AM PST until December 22 at 6:15AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, southern and central Los Angeles County and eastern Ventura County. * WHEN...Until 345 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 208 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated widespread moderate to heavy rain across the advisory area. Rainfall rates of 0.20 to 0.40 inches per hour were common with local rates up to 0.50 inches per hour. There is a slight chance of thunderstorms with briefly higher rates. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have already fallen in much of this area, with local totals over 5 inches. This has caused widespread ponding of water on area roadways with flooding of low-lying areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 inches to 1 inch are expected. This will result in widespread ponding of water on area roadways and flooding of low-lying areas and intersections. There may be rises and flooding of creeks and streams. Rocks and boulders may fall onto roadways, especially below steep terrain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Thousand Oaks, Malibu, Acton, Burbank, Pasadena, Glendale, Torrance, Universal City, North Hollywood, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Van Nuys, Downtown Los Angeles, Encino, Culver City, Santa Monica, Woodland Hills and Northridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
